content: hanging nest basket by amanda corvello what you will need  1 ball of 100% cotton yarn approx 120yrds  crochet hook size h8 5 0mm  tapestry needle  scissors stitch abbreviations st- stitch chain- chain slip_stitch- slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet decrease- single_crochet single_crochet decrease half_double_crochet half_double_crochet increase- half_double_crochet half_double_crochet increase double_crochet- double_crochet fpdc- front post double_crochet see notes bpdc- back post double_crochet see notes notes -the post of a double_crochet is the body of the stitch beneath where you would normally insert into the stitch to make a fpdc yarn over insert the hook behind the post of the previous round s double_crochet working in the front of the fabric then make a double_crochet around the post to make a bpdc yarn over insert the hook in front of the previous round s double_crochet working from behind the fabric then make a double_crochet around the post see images -the type of cotton yarn you use will affect the size and stability of the basket for instance hobby lobby s i love this yarn cotton has a little more stretch to it and will be slightly smaller lily sugar and cream will give you a larger and more rigid basket choose the yarn that will be the best for your intended use and how much weight the basket may be holding fpdc bpdc pattern base work in continuous rounds r1 beginning with a magic_ring half_double_crochet 8 into the circle pull tail tight to close do not join 8 r2 half_double_crochet increase in each st 16 r3 half_double_crochet half_double_crochet increase 8x 24 r4 half_double_crochet in next 2 sts half_double_crochet increase 8x 32 r5 half_double_crochet in next 3 sts half_double_crochet increase 8x 40 r6 half_double_crochet in next 4 sts half_double_crochet increase 8x 48 r7 half_double_crochet in next 5 sts half_double_crochet increase 8x slip_stitch to join round 56 body from here all rounds will be joined and first st will be made in the same stitch you slip_stitch in chain 2 double_crochet in all sts 56 r1 ch1 fpdc bpdc around 56 r2 ch1 bpdc fpdc around 56 repeat row 1 and 2 until body section measures 3 5 opening r1 ch1 single_crochet in next 5 sts single_crochet decrease 8x 48 r2 ch1 single_crochet in all sts 48 r3 chain 1 single_crochet in next 4 sts single_crochet decrease 8x 40 to make a one-handled hanging basket r4 slip_stitch into first st chain 10 skip 2 sts slip_stitch in the next st slip_stitch around entire edge up into the 10 chain handle sts and slip_stitch into where chain sts were attached behind the original slip_stitch cut yarn and fasten_off weave in all ends to make a two-handle table-top basket see modifications r4 single_crochet into first st chain 15 skip 2 sts single_crochet in the next st single_crochet into the next 17 sts chain 15 skip 2 sts single_crochet into the remaining sts in the round slip_stitch into first stitch of this round r5
